term.title: exposure

item.text: Concentration, amount or intensity of a particular physical or chemical agent or environmental agent that reaches the target population, organism, organ, tissue, or cell, usually expressed in numerical terms of concentration, duration, and frequency (for chemical agents and micro-organisms) or intensity (for physical agents).

notes.item: This differs from the definition of @ET02276@.

item.text: Process by which a substance becomes available for absorption by the target population, organism, organ, tissue or cell, by any route.

term.sources: 'Glossary of terms used in toxicokinetics (IUPAC Recommendations 2003)' Nordberg, M.;Duffus, J.;Templeton, D.M.; Pure and Applied Chemistry 2004 76(5) 1033
